body.p: The Board decided not to provide transition requirements for first-time adopters of IFRS Standards because:

li.p: IFRS 1 First-time Adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards provides deemed cost exemptions for items of property, plant and equipment. These exemptions allow a first-time adopter to measure such assets without reference to IAS 16.

if a first-time adopter does not apply those deemed cost exemptions, it would apply all the requirements in IAS 16 retrospectively. The Board concluded that there would be little benefit in providing first-time adopters with an exception or exemption relating to only one aspect of the requirements in IAS 16.
